title: The Kudzu Cookbook: Cooking Up a Storm With That Wild & Crazy Vine That Grows in Miles-Per-Hour!
description: Kudzu was a snafu in America when it was used for temporary groundcover (but continues to take over the nation state by state), but it's a highly-prized & much sought-after delicacy in Asian countries. Lots of fascinating background, humor, recipes, sources for seeds, leaves & powder & more! Every Southern kitchen needs a copy!
author: Carole Marsh
